ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk74:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk74:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were defecating, urinating, and spitting on cultivated plants. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk74:1.3.1_0: “‘When not sick, I will not defecate, urinate, or spit on cultivated plants,’ this is how you should train.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk74:1.4_0: If one is not sick, one should not defecate, urinate, or spit on cultivated plants.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk74:1.5_0: If, out of disrespect, a monk who is not sick defecates, urinates, or spits on cultivated plants, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk74:1.6.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk74:1.8_0: To give rise to the robe.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk74:1.11_0: if he does it in a place with no cultivated plants, but it then spreads to cultivated plants;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk74:1.14_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk74:1.15_0: The fourteenth training rule is finished.
